wikipedia_page.main: Charles McGarel (1788–1876) was an Ireland-born Ulster-Scots merchant and slave owner.  In 1833 the British Government abolished slavery and compensated owners, such as McGarel, who became a major beneficiaries of this scheme.  With his wealth he conducted business in the City of London, funded civic works in his home town of Larne, County Antrim and bought land and property in Ireland.  Having no children, he left his estate to his brother-in-law, James Hogg, on condition that he integrate McGarel into his family name, becoming James McGarel-Hogg, later Lord Magheramorne.
